Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Absence of PKC - alpha attenuates lithium - induced nephrogenic diabetes insipidus .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| PKC - alpha |
| lithium |
| nephrogenic diabetes insipidus |

In this paragraph, the three chemical entities are "PKC - alpha", "lithium", and "nephrogenic diabetes insipidus". "PKC - alpha" and "lithium" are both mentioned explicitly, while "nephrogenic diabetes insipidus" is a medical condition related to the dysfunction of the kidney's ability to concentrate urine, which can be caused by various factors, including lithium exposure.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| lithium |

In this revised list, the only clear chemical entity is "lithium". "PKC - alpha" is a protein kinase C isoform, but it is not a chemical in the traditional sense. "Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus" is a medical condition, not a chemical.
